toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: Vendor ID for an external Financial System. Used if this Vendor has supplied your Financial System.
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Financial System Vendor ID
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__povend_fsvendid__c

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: Inactive Vendors may not be used on new Purchase Orders and may not be set as the Assigned Vendor on Inventory Requisitions.
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Inactive
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__povend_inactive__c

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: When checked, this Vendor is identified as one that supplies Indirect Material.
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Indirect Material Indicator
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__povend_indmtlind__c

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: When the Vendor Lead Time Override is checked, this is the lead time that will be used. Vendor lead time is the time the vendor requires to have the purchased item available to ship. It is expressed in days.
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Vendor Lead Time
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__povend_ltvend__c

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: When checkbox is checked, the Vendor Lead Time on this Vendor record will be used to calculate the Vendor Ship Date (as opposed to the Vendor Lead Time from the PO Commodity Code or Purchase Item Master).
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Vendor LT Override Ind
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__povend_ltvendovrind__c

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: When the Vendor Shipment Lead Time Override is checked, this is the lead time that will be used. This field displays the number of days required to ship from the vendor site to make your dock date.
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Vendor Shipment Lead Time
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__povend_ltvendship__c

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: When checked, the Vendor Shipment Lead Time on this Vendor record will be used to calculate the Vendor Ship Date (as opposed to the Vendor Shipment Lead Time from the Inventory Commodity Code or Inventory Item Master).
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Vendor Shipment LT Override Ind
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__povend_ltvendshipovrind__c

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: When checked, POs placed with this Vendor will be in the Vendor's currency. When unchecked, POs will be in the Home currency as defined on the Company Master.
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Maintenance Currency Indicator
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__povend_maintcurrind__c

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: Vendor Accounting Division
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Z_OBSOLETE

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: When linked to an existing SF Account, this is a look-up field to the SF Account Name and will populate this field and the Salesforce Name field below. For a new SF Account, this field will be set to the value entered as Salesforce name.
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Salesforce Account
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__povend_sf_account__c
toolingEntityParticle.Metadata: <CustomField xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata" > <fullName>rstk__povend__c.rstk__povend_sf_account__c</fullName> <caseSensitive>false</caseSensitive> <deleteConstraint>Restrict</deleteConstraint> <deprecated>false</deprecated> <description>This link is established when the POVEND record is added within the Salesforce Account Maintenance program There is also a ‘lookup’ from the Salesforce Account record to the POVEND This link too is established when the POVEND record is added within the Salesforce Account Maintenance program (page) A deletion of the POVEND record’ in POVEND Maintenance providing there is no POHDR nor POAGRHDR nor POITEMVEND reference. (Also when there is a capability for indirect material requisitions, there can not be a SYREQIND reference. ) Deleting a POVEND record in POVEND maintenance will cause the ‘lookup’ reference to be eliminated on the Salesforce Account record By the same token an Salesforce Account record cannot be deleted if the POVEND record exists and there will be no script which deletes both Salesforce Account Record and POVEND record from within Salesforce Account Maintenance. (DD)</description> <escapeMarkup>false</escapeMarkup> <externalId>false</externalId> <inlineHelpText>When linked to an existing SF Account, this is a look-up field to the SF Account Name and will populate this field and the Salesforce Name field below. For a new SF Account, this field will be set to the value entered as Salesforce name.</inlineHelpText> <isAIPredictionField>false</isAIPredictionField> <isConvertLeadDisabled>false</isConvertLeadDisabled> <isFilteringDisabled>false</isFilteringDisabled> <isNameField>false</isNameField> <isSortingDisabled>false</isSortingDisabled> <label>Salesforce Account</label> <length>0</length> <populateExistingRows>false</populateExistingRows> <precision>0</precision> <referenceTo>Account</referenceTo> <relationshipLabel>Vendor Masters</relationshipLabel> <relationshipName>sf_account_povends</relationshipName> <relationshipOrder>0</relationshipOrder> <reparentableMasterDetail>false</reparentableMasterDetail> <required>false</required> <restrictedAdminField>false</restrictedAdminField> <scale>0</scale> <startingNumber>0</startingNumber> <stripMarkup>false</stripMarkup> <trackFeedHistory>false</trackFeedHistory> <trackHistory>true</trackHistory> <trackTrending>false</trackTrending> <translateData>false</translateData> <type>Lookup</type> <unique>false</unique> <visibleLines>0</visibleLines> <writeRequiresMasterRead>false</writeRequiresMasterRead></CustomField>

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: When linking to an existing SF Account this field is disabled and will be set to the Salesforce Account value selected above. When creating a new SF Account this field is required and will set the SF Account Number and SF Account name values.
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Salesforce Account Name
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__povend_sf_account_name__c

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: This is the name of the individual(s) identified as the Vendor contact. Currently, this field displays the SF Contacts & NOT the Vendor Contacts under the Vendor Contact tab. Therefore, maintenance of these Contacts must be made on the SF Account record.
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Contact
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__povend_sf_contact__c
toolingEntityParticle.Metadata: <CustomField xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata" > <fullName>rstk__povend__c.rstk__povend_sf_contact__c</fullName> <caseSensitive>false</caseSensitive> <deleteConstraint>Restrict</deleteConstraint> <deprecated>false</deprecated> <description>This is a ‘lookup’ to the Salesforce Contact table Label: Salesforce Contact Reference This link is established when the POVEND record is added within the SF Account Maintenance program. It is set to the primary contact for the SF Account to which the POVEND corresponds to (i.e. POVEND_SF_ACCOUNT). This field is not necessarily mandatory (it can be left null in which case no contacts will be set in POHDR_SF_VENDCONTACT for example). There is also to be a ‘lookup’ from the Salesforce Account record to the POVEND This is a reference to the Salesforce Contact Table and corresponds to a valid SF Contact that corresponds to the SF Account to that which the POVEND points to (POVEND_SF_ACCOUNT). (DD)</description> <escapeMarkup>false</escapeMarkup> <externalId>false</externalId> <inlineHelpText>This is the name of the individual(s) identified as the Vendor contact. Currently, this field displays the SF Contacts & NOT the Vendor Contacts under the Vendor Contact tab. Therefore, maintenance of these Contacts must be made on the SF Account record.</inlineHelpText> <isAIPredictionField>false</isAIPredictionField> <isConvertLeadDisabled>false</isConvertLeadDisabled> <isFilteringDisabled>false</isFilteringDisabled> <isNameField>false</isNameField> <isSortingDisabled>false</isSortingDisabled> <label>Contact</label> <length>0</length> <populateExistingRows>false</populateExistingRows> <precision>0</precision> <referenceTo>Contact</referenceTo> <relationshipLabel>Vendor Masters</relationshipLabel> <relationshipName>Vendor_Masters</relationshipName> <relationshipOrder>0</relationshipOrder> <reparentableMasterDetail>false</reparentableMasterDetail> <required>false</required> <restrictedAdminField>false</restrictedAdminField> <scale>0</scale> <startingNumber>0</startingNumber> <stripMarkup>false</stripMarkup> <trackFeedHistory>false</trackFeedHistory> <trackHistory>false</trackHistory> <trackTrending>false</trackTrending> <translateData>false</translateData> <type>Lookup</type> <unique>false</unique> <visibleLines>0</visibleLines> <writeRequiresMasterRead>false</writeRequiresMasterRead></CustomField>

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: This denotes the currency used by the given Vendor as defined on the Salesforce Account record.
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Vendor Currency
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__povend_vendcurr__c
toolingEntityParticle.Metadata: <CustomField xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata" > <fullName>rstk__povend__c.rstk__povend_vendcurr__c</fullName> <caseSensitive>false</caseSensitive> <deleteConstraint>Restrict</deleteConstraint> <deprecated>false</deprecated> <description>This is the ISO Code. Must be a valid SF ISO This is set from the SF Account’s currency. The term in their documentation is Account Currency The vendor should be established with their own currency This is set when adding the vendor and it is assumed that this is a valid value on the Currency table in SF but will depend on the validity of the Salesforce Account Currency field value It is not expected that this will be maintained in POVEND Maintenance but rather will be maintained in SF Account Maintenance and there will be scripts on the SF Account Maintenance Page which will change this value if the SF Account Currency value changes. When adding a new POVEND if an existing SF account is linked then POVEND_VENDCURR is set from account currency otherwise it is set from SYCMP_HOMECURR. (DD)</description> <escapeMarkup>false</escapeMarkup> <externalId>false</externalId> <inlineHelpText>This denotes the currency used by the given Vendor as defined on the Salesforce Account record.</inlineHelpText> <isAIPredictionField>false</isAIPredictionField> <isConvertLeadDisabled>false</isConvertLeadDisabled> <isFilteringDisabled>false</isFilteringDisabled> <isNameField>false</isNameField> <isSortingDisabled>false</isSortingDisabled> <label>Vendor Currency</label> <length>0</length> <populateExistingRows>false</populateExistingRows> <precision>0</precision> <referenceTo>rstk__sycurr__c</referenceTo> <relationshipLabel>Vendor Masters</relationshipLabel> <relationshipName>Vendor_Masters</relationshipName> <relationshipOrder>0</relationshipOrder> <reparentableMasterDetail>false</reparentableMasterDetail> <required>false</required> <restrictedAdminField>false</restrictedAdminField> <scale>0</scale> <startingNumber>0</startingNumber> <stripMarkup>false</stripMarkup> <trackFeedHistory>false</trackFeedHistory> <trackHistory>true</trackHistory> <trackTrending>false</trackTrending> <translateData>false</translateData> <type>Lookup</type> <unique>false</unique> <visibleLines>0</visibleLines> <writeRequiresMasterRead>false</writeRequiresMasterRead></CustomField>

toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText: Location ID used for subcontract items to be shipped to this Vendor.
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Vendor Loc ID
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__povend_vendlocid__c
toolingEntityParticle.Metadata: <CustomField xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata" > <fullName>rstk__povend__c.rstk__povend_vendlocid__c</fullName> <caseSensitive>false</caseSensitive> <deleteConstraint>Restrict</deleteConstraint> <deprecated>false</deprecated> <description>This can be null or this can be the Stock Loc Id of a Stock Loc Id Master whose SYLOCID_VENDLOCIND = ‘T’ Only one vendor can have this Vendor Loc ID value if not null and therefore this is checked in POVEND Maintenance to insure that this is the case. This is used in PO Subcontract Backflush and will be used in PO Entry to facilitate the setting of the Location Id from which subcontract PO Component is issued when Override Backflush Loc ID is selected (represents a location at the vendor). This also is used in POITEMVEND maintenance to facilitate the setting of the POITEMVEND_VENDLOCID. (DD)</description> <escapeMarkup>false</escapeMarkup> <externalId>false</externalId> <inlineHelpText>Location ID used for subcontract items to be shipped to this Vendor.</inlineHelpText> <isAIPredictionField>false</isAIPredictionField> <isConvertLeadDisabled>false</isConvertLeadDisabled> <isFilteringDisabled>false</isFilteringDisabled> <isNameField>false</isNameField> <isSortingDisabled>false</isSortingDisabled> <label>Vendor Loc ID</label> <length>0</length> <populateExistingRows>false</populateExistingRows> <precision>0</precision> <referenceTo>rstk__sylocid__c</referenceTo> <relationshipLabel>Vendor Masters</relationshipLabel> <relationshipName>Vendor_Masters</relationshipName> <relationshipOrder>0</relationshipOrder> <reparentableMasterDetail>false</reparentableMasterDetail> <required>false</required> <restrictedAdminField>false</restrictedAdminField> <scale>0</scale> <startingNumber>0</startingNumber> <stripMarkup>false</stripMarkup> <trackFeedHistory>false</trackFeedHistory> <trackHistory>false</trackHistory> <trackTrending>false</trackTrending> <translateData>false</translateData> <type>Lookup</type> <unique>false</unique> <visibleLines>0</visibleLines> <writeRequiresMasterRead>false</writeRequiresMasterRead></CustomField>
